author: G. Allen Johnson
title: Famed documentarian Marcel Ophuls turns camera on self for memoir
text:
Photo: Marcel Ophuls Marcel Ophuls (right) with a German war correspondent in his film “The Troubles We’ve Seen: A History of Journalism in Wartime.” Marcel Ophuls (right) with a German war correspondent in his film...
He has made some of the most famous documentaries about the human cost of World War II — his most well-known, “The Sorrow and the Pity,” is forever immortalized as a symbol of Woody Allen and Diane Keaton’s relationship in “Annie Hall” — but Marcel Ophuls’ long, rich life hasn’t unfolded the way some might expect from a super-serious documentarian.
